Limited access to sunlight: Some homes may not receive enough sunlight to effectively power the solar panels, which could make them less effective.
Aesthetic concerns: Some people might not like the look of solar panels on their homes, which could impact property values and appeal.
Maintenance requirements: Solar panels need to be clean andlymaintained to work effectively, which could be a hassle for homeowners.
Environmental impact: Solar panels need to be manufactured and disposed of, which could have negative environmental impacts.
Limited availability of renewable energy: Solar energy is limited in some areas and time of year, which could mean that homeowners may need to rely on other sources of energy at some times.
